greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = phi(c(n)) - tau(phi(c(n))), where c(n) is the n-th composite number.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. Ziegenbalg, Phi, Tau, Sigma in Elementary Number Theory
mathematica: Composites := Select[Range[2, 10000], ! PrimeQ[#] &]; Composite[n_] := Last[Take[Composites, n]]; T[n_] := EulerPhi[n]; Table[T[Composite[n]] - DivisorSigma[0, T[Composite[n]]], {n, 200}]
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = {forcomposite(n=1, nn, ec = eulerphi(n); print1(ec - numdiv(ec), ", "););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 11 2015
results.author: _Carlos Eduardo Olivieri_, Jan 02 2015
ext: Name clarified by _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 20 2016
